boardgame.name: <firewall>
Firewall
boardgame.description:
Firewall is a hacking themed game designed for 2-4 players. Each player is trying to hack into the same node by controlling the most ports. Only one hacker comes out on top.

Hackers take control of ports by placing the most packets on them. They can also play a firewall on a port to block all other players from playing on that port. If a player is restricted by a opponent's firewall they may place a backdoor next to it to also be able to play on that port. Crafty hackers can also use spikes to their advantage by removing a die from the game. If a player manages to play a second firewall of their color then that port is locked down and no player may play anything on it (including spikes).

Each player starts with ten dice. At the beginning of the game the first player rolls to see how many ports there will be (from 2-4). Next the first player rolls 2 dice and places one on an open port. The next player rolls 3 dice and places one on the board. Play continues with each player rolling 3 dice and placing one until all players are out of dice or all ports are locked down.

The player with the most ports controlled wins. If there is a tie for ports controlled then the tied players count their total number of packets on their controlled ports. Whoever has the most packets wins.

boardgame.name: Zero Hour: Survival Horror Card Game
boardgame.description:
Zero Hour is a survival horror game for 2-6 players. Players take turns competing against one another to see who will last from midnight to sunrise. Each player must keep their children alive and sane through the night.

The school bus sat waiting in front of the fairgrounds. Children from all parts of Harlington County were excited to start their trip, eager to see the Blue Mountain Campground on its opening weekend. It was late evening when the Mayor wished the kids luck as they rose from their picnic tables, hurriedly shoving bits of cake into their mouths as they climbed aboard the old school bus. Songs and the laughter of children would fill the first few hours, only to be cut short when one of the children called out "I just saw a dark man standing in the road ahead of us." As the laughter subsided and the children strained their eyes to see into the darkness, tree limbs burst through the windows, sending tiny glass fragments into the air that found their way into the soft flesh of the children. Metal groaned and cried out as the bus pitched over onto its side, sliding before finally ending up in a ditch on the side of the road. Screams echoed out of the interior of the bus as the children begun moving and freeing themselves from the wreckage. The driver lay dead against the wheel. It was almost midnight, and the children were alone in woods that could swallow them from every angle. It would be daybreak before anyone would even begin looking for them...

Players choose 1 card from the six gifted children cards and 4 random cards from the 24 children and assemble their survivors. Each child card displays the child's name, age, sanity level and "end game" point value. Your goal is to keep as many children alive and as sane as possible by sunrise. The gifted children have high sanity values and a special ability to help their group survive. These special abilities include the power to absorb a creature’s damage, evade enemy attacks and even pass damage meant for you onto your opponent's survivors. Survival is key and differs from child to child. Some kids are young and low on sanity, while others may have increased sanity due to age or street smarts. Each child card contains a simple descriptive term like Bully, Class Clown, or Doll Baby to give insight into each child and add flavor to the core game.

The goal of Zero Hour is to survive from midnight until dawn. Each turn, a card from the Hour deck is flipped over, advancing time forward by one hour. The player with the highest point total at sunrise is declared the winner. Each child has a point value indicated on their card that comes into play once the game is over. Each player adds together whatever cards they are still holding to determine their point value total. This number will be between 0-25 points.

The Game contains:
6 Gifted Child cards
24 Child cards
30 Sanity cards
8 Clock cards
1 black/white Creature die
1 white Escape die
1 rules booklet
100-card Exploration Deck (The Slender Man)

boardgame.name: Cucco 21
boardgame.description:
Cucco 21 is a deck of Il Cucco cards which specializes playing "Cambio". It has some modifications both in the flow of the game and added special power cards.

The goal of the game is same as "Cambio" - getting most number of chips when someone got bankrupted. Everyone holds only one card and you are penalized if your card is the lowest of all. From the start player, counter-clockwise, a player can either change a card with next player (person on your right) or not. Finally, the last player can change his/her card with the top card of the deck, if he/she wishes.

In the first 3 rounds, the loser get penalized 1, 2, or 3 points according to the number of rounds. From the 4th round and on, the loser is out of the play. The last one stands gets all chips in the pot. Then start again from round 1.

There are several cards with special abilities. In cucco 21, some abilities are added and their ranks have been changed.

boardgame.name: Gamedec
boardgame.description:
Near the end of the XXII century games are called "sensory worlds" and the outsider world is called "realium". There are thousands of games - virtual spaces, in which people willingly spend time... or their entire life. A shadow looms over this digital utopia in the form of hacker attacks. The only ones able to defend the sensory worlds are Gamedecs: hardboiled private detectives specializing in the mysteries of the virtual worlds. Become one of them and investigate cases in sensory worlds, gather clues and equipment, conduct corporate investigations and cross them or cooperate with them. Watch out though - your reputation is your ticket to better jobs. But beware - every passing second leads closer to a total crash of the virtual net.

Gamedec is an adventure game themed around Martin Ann's "Gamedec" novels. Players try to solve cases connected to the global hacker attacks. Each player choose one from 10 available game-detectives and, during the course of the game, upgrade his/her character by collecting equipment cards, acquiring skills (which helps solving cases) and improving reputation (which provides more case-cards). The game ends either when one of the characters collects enough clues to stop the hackers, or when the Net is too damaged and need to be shut down (all players lose).

boardgame.name: Pong Tactics
boardgame.description: Pong Tactics is a strategy card game that adds new gameplay mechanics to the classic drinking game beer pong. 10 cups are set up on either side of an 8 foot table. One Formation card is selected to determine the formation of the 10 cups on both sides of the table and then the cards are set aside. Cups may be filled with water or beer (if players are of legal drinking age). The remainder of the game is Action Cards. These cards impact the normal beer pong rules in various ways, such as changing the shot, number of shots, cards in hand, blocking shots, determining the end of the game and much more. The game is played by teams of two players on each side of the table. Each player on a team takes one shot at the cups on the other side of the table; if they make the ball into a cup, it is removed and the player takes a drink either from their own drink or the cup. The goal is to remove all of your opponent's cups by making all the shots. The Action Cards can aid your team or hinder your opponent in achieving the end game goal.

boardgame.name: Salt & Burn
boardgame.description:
Salt & Burn is a tabletop competitive action/adventure board game about hunting supernatural creatures. With 2-6 players, each person draws a randomly selected character card with health and damage stats, and a random vehicle card. There are 12 unique Angel, Human and Demon Hunter character cards, each with different stats for health and damage and different benefits based on species

Throughout the game you can collect item cards that modify your health or damage, and collect trunk cards which are like spells that you can save and cast during your turn to help you or hinder other hunters. If you die during the course of a fight, you will have to go to Purgatory until you roll a 3 and return to the start of the game without any of your worldly possessions.

Players travel the game board to hunt down monsters. Monsters are drawn at random along with other Event cards for an element of surprise. The more monsters you kill, the more lives you save. If you kill a particularly dangerous monster, you'll save more lives in the process, and win the game faster. The first hunter to save 10 lives wins the game.

boardgame.name: Blind Threat
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

“It sounded like a sweet job. A chance to get into bed with the St Cloud Dynasty. Real money. All we had to do was break into a secure corporate satellite base, and use an ‘acquired’ bit of military kit to upload something or other… no real trouble. No real threat. Zarking dogma… I should have seen the crapstorm coming. How could I have been so blind?”

Blind Threat is the first adventure of High-Space, the best-selling Savage Worlds sci-fi setting. Your heroes take on the roles of a rag-tag team of mercenaries ready to do any dirty job that comes your way. And when the powerful St Cloud group offers you what looks to be a walk in the park, you jump at the chance.

Blind Threat is the perfect introductory adventure for High-Space. It demonstrates the new rules for social interactions, hyper-sonic chases and battles, and starship combat. Plus is has a large battlemap of a corporate satellite uplink facility – 24 pages in easy to print format!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Attack!
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Attack! is a fast-paced, action packed dice game where you and your friends venture into an ancient dungeon, defeat angry monsters, and search for treasure.

Each die represents a monster. A single die is a strong monster while rolling a handful of dice represents weak minions fighting at their master's will.

The game pack easily accommodates four players and more can join in on the fun with additional dice packs.

boardgame.name: The Longest Trench
boardgame.description:
The Longest Trench is a two-player card game about the First World War from the strategic viewpoint. The game recreates World War I in a historical series of land and sea battles. The Central Powers (Germany and her allies) are opposed to the Entente (Great Britain, France, Russia and their allies).

As a supreme commander, you try to defeat your opponent by allocating your troops, planes, and ships with possible support (from air, mines, trenches, etc.) on the right front to the right time.

The Longest Trench is primarily designed as a quick-playing fun game and players can finish a game in one or two hours.

boardgame.name: Smooth & Rifled
boardgame.description:
Smooth&Rifled is a game system designed to recreate skirmish games with 28, 20 or 15mm miniatures. This very first edition covers the period from approximately 1700 to approximately 1900. The French and Indian Wars, the American Revolution, the Napoleonic wars, the American Civil War and the warsof the Colonial era are just some of the periods you can play with S&R.

The Smooth&Rifled rulebook contains the nuts&bolts of play. Each conflict covered by the game is available from the publisher as separate free pdf's.

boardgame.name: Viking
boardgame.description:
The game is about attacking the settlements of other vikings, sink their viking ships and plunder their gold. To win, one must collect 2 golden treasures on one's own settlement or sink all competing viking ships. [translation of box cover blurb]

Each turn, a player rolls two dice and moves either one of initially 7 ships a number of squares equal to the sum of the dice or two ships each according to one of the dice. While moving, ships must avoid squares with obtacles or islands and other ships, except on the final square where it can sink another player's ship or enter an island. When sinking a ship with a gold treasure or entering an island with one, a ship captures the treasure.

Game contents:

1 board
7 plastic viking ships in each of the 4 colours
4 golden plastic disks to represent treasures
2 normal 6-sided dice

boardgame.name: BATTA HAI
boardgame.description:
From the game box:

"THIS IS THE HOME EDITION OF THE EXCITING T.V. GAME-BATTA HAI. BATTA HAI WAS DEVELOPED BY LYON S. WEIR OF HOLLYWOOD FOR THE ENTERTAINMENT INDUSTRY, BUT THIS PARTICULAR EDITION HAS BEEN DESIGNED BY HIM WITH HOME ENTERTAINMENT IN MIND. YOU, YOUR FAMILY, AND YOUR FRIENDS WILL ENJOY PLAYING IT OVER AND OVER, FOR EACH GAME WILL BE DIFFERENT FROM THE PREVIOUS ONE."

Batta Hai is a Bingo-like game with endless variations: Twelve different boards, forty nine different calls. Each board can be played in different ways, finding the way is the key to victory.
Once a piece has been called it may be arranged on the player's board, or set aside. Only the first piece called must remain in position for the duration of the game.

The player who correctly covers all the numbered and arrow squares and calls out "Batta Hai" wins the game because the same play piece, when called, may complete more than one board.
